questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
questions.answer: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the <div> element in HTML?
questions.answer: The <div> element is a block-level container typically used to group HTML elements together.

questions.question: Explain the difference between <div> and <span>.
questions.answer: The <div> element is a block-level container, while the <span> element is an inline-level container.

questions.question: What is CSS used for in web development?
questions.answer: CSS is used for styling the appearance of HTML elements on web pages.

questions.question: Explain the difference between padding and margin in CSS.
questions.answer: Padding is the space inside the border of an element, while margin is the space outside the border.

questions.question: What is a CSS selector? Provide examples.
questions.answer: A CSS selector targets specific HTML elements to apply styling. Examples: class (.class), ID (#id), element (element).

questions.question: What is JavaScript and its role in web development?
questions.answer: JavaScript is a scripting language used for adding interactivity and behavior to web pages.

questions.question: Explain the difference between == and === in JavaScript.
questions.answer: == is a loose equality comparison, === is strict equality comparison, checking both value and type.

questions.question: What is a closure in JavaScript? Provide an example.
questions.answer: A closure is a function that retains access to variables from its parent scope even after the parent function has finished executing. Example: function outer() { var x = 10; function inner() { return x; } return inner; } var closure = outer(); console.log(closure());

questions.question: What is React and its main features?
questions.answer: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces, known for its component-based architecture, virtual DOM, and declarative syntax.

questions.question: Explain the concept of Virtual DOM in React.
questions.answer: Virtual DOM is a lightweight copy of the actual DOM, used by React to efficiently update the UI by comparing changes before making updates to the real DOM.

questions.question: What are React hooks? Provide examples of their usage.
questions.answer: React hooks are functions that enable developers to use state and other React features in functional components. Examples: useState(), useEffect().
